column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The award-winning BWS customer experience training program was born out of the need to engage a new generation of younger shoppers. The training program was peer-led, utilising approximately 70 Store Managers nationwide. Having peers deliver the training maximised buy-in and ensured the approach came from a place of experience and credibility. Not only did they deliver the training, but their passion and advocacy demonstrated the very customer experience principles the training was looking to instil.
column20: BWS customer experience training program, the younger shopper, Store Manager

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In F23, Endeavour became a signatory to the 40:40 Vision, an initiative led by HESTA, supported by industry partners, to pursue diversity in executive leadership in ASX 300 companies. As of 25 June 2023, women represent 41% of senior management positions, an improvement on F22 and reflective of Endeavour's female talent pipeline and focus in this area. Women also make up 43% of the membership of the Endeavour Group Board. Endeavour plans to strengthen nomination and voting systems to ensure equal opportunities for all genders.
column20: 40:40 Vision, diversity, HESTA

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Endeavour's Proud at Endeavour group has moved at pace in F23 to advocate and mobilise that vision for its team and the communities it is in. Proud at Endeavour has grown to more than 367 LGBTQ+ and Ally team members across Australia, bringing its value of inclusion to life for the wider business and supporting its customer-facing brands to bring diversity to the forefront.
column20: Proud at Endeavour, LGBTQ+, customer-facing brand

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Endeavour sponsored the second annual Light Up the Night Gala in May, raising much-needed funds for the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation. The Foundation aims to support LGBTQ victims and survivors of domestic violence and abuse through awareness, education and breaking down barriers to accessing support.
column20: Light Up The Night, LGBTQ, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Since 2019, Endeavour has partnered with ACON, a community organisation supporting health, inclusion and ending HIV for people of diverse sexualities and genders. 579 Dan Murphy's and BWS stores nationally are now registered as a Welcoming Place as part of ACON's Welcome Here Project, which helps businesses create and promote visibly welcoming and inclusive environments for LGBTQ+ communities.
column20: ACON, HIV, diverse sexuality

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column7: Endeavour expects its employees to respectfully treat each other, customers, and suppliers. Endeavour also trains its employees on these expectations through its Code of Conduct.

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: In F23, Endeavour invested in its Human Rights Program and partnered with two specialist business and human rights firms to identify, assess and address human rights risks in its operations and supply chain. The Board is updated quarterly on Endeavour's Human Rights Program, with detailed reporting through the Audit, Risk and Compliance Management Committee.
column20: Human Rights Program, human rights firm, supply chain

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: This year, Endeavour hosted an engagement session with representatives from 19 growers in the Barossa region in South Australia. Based on listening, learning, and building capacity, the event helped Endeavour understand the barriers they're facing and how it can support them to uplift human rights practices in the viticulture industry.
column20: Engagement session, Barossa region, human rights practice

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: In F23, Endeavour strengthened and clarified its Responsible Sourcing Program. The framework ensures Endeavour's products are ethically produced and sourced, and its suppliers manage labour and human rights risks, including risks of forced and child labour and modern slavery.
column20: Responsible Sourcing Program, labour, human rights risk

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In May, Endeavour hosted a voluntary education workshop on The Voice with Thomas Mayo, a Kaurareg Aboriginal and Kalkalgal, Erubamle Torres Strait Islander man from Larrakia Country who is on the Government's First Nations Referendum Working Group. More than 100 of Endeavour's team attended the workshop on Gadigal Country in Redfern to understand more about constitutional recognition, The Voice proposal, and the practical change it would have in addressing real community challenges.
column20: Education workshop, The Voice, constitutional recognition

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour encouraged its team members to continue their reconciliation journey during National Reconciliation Week in May. Teams nationwide were invited to participate in a virtual panel on reconciliation. Endeavour also held information sessions about secondment opportunities with Jawun and offered team members a chance to attend a live and interactive yarning learning webinar.
column20: National Reconciliation Week, reconciliation journey, secondment opportunity

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Since 2013, Endeavour's partnership with the Jawun Indigenous Community Program has offered more than 35 team members opportunities to share their skills and experience with and listen and learn from 20 Indigenous community organisations across Australia. Neil Cairns, Store Manager at Dan Murphy's Mosman, NSW, recently completed a six-week secondment with Gudjagang Ngara Li-dhi (GNL), an Indigenous organisation based in Darkinjung Country on the NSW Central Coast. GNL's programs focus on supporting vulnerable Indigenous children, young people and families in the local area through early intervention and prevention services and specialised casework.
column20: Jawun, secondment, Indigenous child

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In October 2022, Endeavour launched its Reflect Reconciliation Action Plan, created in open dialogue with Reconciliation Australia and its First Nations team members. It sets the foundations for improving cultural competency and inclusion across Endeavour's business. Endeavour has built trust, respect and relationships with Indigenous communities and organisations.
column20: Reflect Reconciliation Action Plan, Reconciliation Australia, First Nations

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In December 2022, Endeavour partnered with Yaandina Community Services in Roebourne, WA, to host a specially created community event in Karratha: 'Let's Talk About Moderation'. The event is designed to promote moderation in the Pilbara while learning from and connecting with experts in the Alcohol and Other Drugs services space. It attracted 30 regional leaders, including mental health experts and community groups. The event featured interactive, informative discussions about the principles of safe drinking while showcasing the growing range of low and no-alcohol products available in BWS Karratha.
column20: Let's Talk About Moderation, community event, Yaandina

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour is proud to be one of the major supporters of 'Always respect, always DrinkWise' during the 2023 State of Origin Series. The campaign focused on encouraging moderation and promoting respect for each other during major sporting events and had the support of various State Governments and Police Services.
column20: Always respect, always DrinkWise, State of Origin series, moderation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In F23, Endeavour supported the NSW Government's 'Plan B' awareness campaign over Christmas, New Year, and the ANZAC Day long weekend. The campaign encourages drivers to make good choices to get home safely after drinking. Endeavour is uniquely placed to communicate targeted safety messages, as in many cases, its customers are driving to and from its stores to make purchases.
column20: Plan B, NSW Government, safety message

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour worked with DrinkWise to support Schoolies-targeted responsible consumption campaigns and led initiatives to deter underage drinking during the November-December Schoolies period. The initiative was driven by Endeavour's purpose and commitment to help people enjoy pleasant moments responsibly.
column20: Schoolies, DrinkWise, underage drinking

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour is supporting the development of a feasibility study to create a new Youth Centre for the Bagot Community outside Darwin. The project involves local youth in its development to educate and promote a sense of pride and connection for the community, which will ultimately benefit from a new safe space and give them better access to health, hygiene, and Alcohol and Other Drugs (AOD) support services.
column20: Feasibility study, Youth Centre, Bagot Community

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour began supporting the creation of a new Yarning Circle for the Sanderson Middle School, providing a safe, calm and inclusive area to assist with cultural learning. The students have been involved in designing, building and developing artwork around the Yarning Circle, which aims to improve student engagement, cultural learning and attendance at school while providing a space for students to connect.
column20: Yarning Circle, Sanderson Middle School, cultural learning

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In F24, Endeavour will support and invest in Damien Mick's Strong and Connected program, which focuses on mentoring and supporting young people using youth transport services to establish connections. The program aims to build trust, cultural connections and respect with young people over time to impact families and the broader community positively.
column20: Strong and Connected program, Damien Mick, youth transport service

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In June 2022, Endeavour formally partnered with the Larrakia Nation Aboriginal Corporation. Larrakia Nation is the peak representative organisation for the Larrakia people, the traditional owners of the Darwin region and a major service provider for Aboriginal people in the area. The partnership is a long-term commitment to local engagement and positive change, as Endeavour and Larrakia Nation work together to address community issues in Darwin.
column20: Larrakia Nation Aboriginal Corporation, traditional owner, Darwin

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour's partnership with the Larrakia Nation Aboriginal Corporation included the development of a five-week Larrakia Nation-run cultural engagement program designed to make the Darwin team and the broader community feel safer. This program involved day and night patrols around Endeavour's retail sites in the Darwin area, supporting the reduction of anti-social behaviour on Larrakia Land.
column20: Cultural engagement program, Larrakia, Darwin

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Endeavour and Larrakia Nation's partnership promoted the implementation of Larrakia Protocols in BWS stores across Darwin and Palmerston as a reminder to everyone to be respectful when purchasing alcohol. The Larrakia Protocols are played in eight different Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander languages, communicating a message of respect for locals and people travelling from remote regions of the NT and interstate. The languages featured are English (using Larrakia person), Yolngu Matha (East Arnhem), Anindilyakwa (Groote Eylandt), Modern Tiwi (Tiwi Islands), Kriol (Big Rivers region Ã¢ÂÂ Katherine), Murrinh Patha (Wadeye), Kunwinjku (Gunbalanya) and Warlpiri (Central Australia).
column20: Larrakia Protocol, Darwin, BWS store
